medical_history.chief_complaint: Hereditary pituitary hyperplasia with early-onset gigantism.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with rapid and excess growth starting at 1 year of age, with increased perspiration, coarsening of facial features, and acral enlargement by 18 months, where height exceeded the 97th percentile. Growth rate peaked at 0.5-1.0 cm/week until surgical intervention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The mother and both sons exhibited very early-onset gigantism associated with high levels of serum GH and prolactin. The older brother underwent total hypophysectomy after failure of medical treatments. The younger brother demonstrated similar symptoms with additional findings relevant to pituitary hyperplasia.
medical_history.family_history: The family has a history of hereditary pituitary hyperplasia as the mother had similar symptoms of gigantism and underwent surgical treatment.
